CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 5, 1966, pg. 1B, reads: "Guests at the home of Mrs. Gittens, left, during the Mother's Club meeting here Mrs. Priscilla Downing, right seated, and Miss Phyllis Garland now of Chicago who was visiting her parents, the Percy Garlands. - Harris Photo." Accompanying article by Toki Schalk Johnson reads: "Indian summer sent warming rays of golden sunlight on the city of McKeesport last week to make the top flight social events taking place, happy riches of delight.  The celebrated Semper Fidelis Club gave its fourth annual 'Woman of the Year' luncheon.  It was just a marvelous excuse for the feminine guests to arrive in glittering splendor to honor Miss Jeanne Dix, teacher in Pittsburgh School System.  Adding to an exciting afternoon, John Clay, young designer, showed some of his own creations, and then demonstrated how he designs with brush and paint. Another day, the home of Mrs. Virginia Gittens was a joyous spot when the Mothers Club surprised devoted member Mrs. Samuel Ethel Golden with a handkerchief shower.  It's moments like these that make life worth living and club work more enjoyable. - Toki Johnson."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Virginia Gittens, Phyllis Garland, and Priscilla Downing wearing eyeglasses around neck, seated in living room of Gittens home for Mother's Club meeting, McKeesport
